```{r, message = FALSE}
# Load libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(stringr)
source("helper.R")
```

```{r}
# Read in raw data from the Veterans surveys. These are the files downloaded from survey monkey saved as a .csv
raw_data_general <- read.csv("data/general_nat.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
raw_data_botanist <- read.csv("data/botanist_nat.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
raw_data_bask <- read.csv("data/bask_nat.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
raw_data_healing_rose <- read.csv("data/healing_rose_nat.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
```

```{r}
# Pull out all responses for Q65 (a choose all question), combine, turn into a tidy data format for further processing then determine 'question n'
Q65 <- "How.many.milliliters..mL..of.tincture.are.you.using.per.week..Note..30mL...1oz"
Q65_final_response <- "X.315"

Q65_general <- get_choose_all(raw_data_general, q.name = Q65, f.response = Q65_final_response)
Q65_bask <- get_choose_all(raw_data_bask, q.name = Q65, f.response = Q65_final_response)
Q65_botanist <- get_choose_all(raw_data_botanist, q.name = Q65, f.response = Q65_final_response)
Q65_healing_rose <- get_choose_all(raw_data_healing_rose, q.name = Q65, f.response = Q65_final_response)

Q65_all <- rbind(Q65_general, Q65_bask, Q65_botanist, Q65_healing_rose) %>%
  tidy_choose_all()

number_of_people <- length(unique(Q65_all$id))
```

```{r}
# Manipulate data into a graphable format
Q65_plot <-
  Q65_all %>%
  group_by(chosen) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(percent_all = count / sum(count)) %>%
  mutate(percent_responded = count / number_of_people)
```

```{r}
# Plot with percents and response counts
r <- 
  ggplot(Q65_plot, aes(x = reorder(chosen, count), y = percent_responded)) +
  geom_bar(stat = 'identity') +
  coord_flip() +
  geom_text(aes(label= paste(round(percent_responded,2), count, sep = "***")))

r
```

```{r}
# Save graph as PNG, plot data as csv, and all question data including response IDs as csv (save question n and N at end of plot file as "_x.x")
ggsave(filename = 'vet_q65_tincture_weekly.png', plot = r, device = 'png')

write.csv(Q65_plot, 'vet_q65_tincture_weekly_88.csv', row.names = FALSE)

write.csv(Q65_all, 'vet_q65_tincture_weekly_ids.csv', row.names = FALSE)
```
